/* References */
/* References */

/* Rise to stardom: 1995–1998 */ The group apparently converged with producer P.M. Dawn in late 1996, to record two songs. Soundtrack contribution was not composed nor recorded in 1997, as music news outlets reported it early in January 1997.
/* Rise to stardom: 1995–1998 */ [[User:Carmaker1|Carmaker1]], please don't remove other important source like RIAA when replacing some of the sources.

/* Further commercial success: 1999–2001 */ It's True is registered under a creation date of Q4 1999 to Max Martin and other Cheiron publishers, rl 11/21/00. It is likely that the song was completed in July 2000 rather than created during that time
/* Further commercial success: 1999–2001 */ I recently found an article from October 2000 mentioning them doing studio work, but it likely there were just mixing rather than recording.
/* Rise to stardom: 1995–1998 */ June 10 is correct, but like I said before it was preceded by radio in May. A record company is not going to risk single sales by not having radio airplay precede it.

Ok I am reverting all your edits, and please stop right here, we need to discuss what it is you are doing. You are beginning to damage.
/* Rise to stardom: 1995-1998 */

/* Rise to stardom: 1995-1998 */ Sites like Billboard may reflect the time period from when an album was released, but not the actual day of release. The Swiss Charts do not account for other EU nations in 1995 and early 1996.

/* Rise to stardom: 1995-1998 */ That is a charting date, which does appear to be incorrect. Billboard on that page has issued dates for all albums that don't correspond with the official releases. That page shouldn't be a source for release dates.

/* Rise to stardom: 1995-1998 */ I don't believe that is useful source either. Those Billboard dates are not applicable as they mean date of entry on the charts, not date of release. Also, please provide another source than the Swiss charts.
/* Rise to stardom: 1995-1998 */ This claim about Jive declining to release ''Anywhere For You'' shortly after the video was shot cannot be inserted until there is a source supporting that statement.

/* Rise to stardom: 1995-1998 */ OK, we won't be replacing highly reliable sources with google-search, please locate another highly reliable source then we can replace it, for now let's keep it as is.
/* Further commercial success: 1999-2001 */
/* Further commercial success: 1999-2001 */
/* Rise to stardom: 1995-1998 */

/* Rise to stardom: 1995-1998 */ These are researched facts, in which the sources are missing at the moment. I am working to find them. The album notably was selling by October 1996 in Canada, so the original date of September 1996 is correct.
